channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: California’s CEOs Aren’t Happy About the Proposed Billionaire Tax—With Some Notable Exceptions
item.description: Exclusive Inc. data shows mixed sentiments on the ground in the Golden State.

item.title: Exxon and Chevron decline new spending in Venezuela while taking a wait-and-see approach for the years ahead
item.description: Exxon maintains long-term interest in Venezuela despite Trump's threat to keep the company out, while Chevron aims to hike its Venezuelan volumes with...

item.title: This Popular Sandwich Chain Could Raise Over $1B in an IPO. Here’s What’s Behind the Move
item.description: The public offering could be one of the only for a restaurant chain in years.

item.title: This AI-related lawsuit could be just the beginning of many
item.description: What many applicants may not realize is that, nowadays, the first hurdle in applying for a job is dealing with AI. Candidates now often must clear an ...

item.title: Five years after the short squeeze, GameStop’s CEO is betting on a ‘genius or totally foolish’ $100 billion-plus acquisition
item.description: CEO Ryan Cohen stands to receive $35 billion if he successfully delivers a $100 billion market capitalization for the company.

item.title: Right before Trump named Warsh to lead the Fed, Powell seemed to respond to some of his biggest complaints about the central bank
item.description: “I mean, if it’s just a question of using better models, bring them on. Where are they? We’ll take them.”

item.title: In 2026, most workers are still languishing
item.description: The feeling of “languishing” is likely relatable for many workers—even if they don’t quite have that exact language for it. And new research shows it’...

item.title: What to know about Trump’s Fed chair nominee Kevin Warsh
item.description: President Donald Trump says he’ll tap former Federal Reserve governor Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair to replace Jerome Powell in May — with Trump b...

item.title: 3 big hurdles undermine Trump’s plan to extract Greenland’s mineral wealth—and America’s fraying relationship with Europe is one of them
item.description: Few friends, local politics and logistical challenges make mining in Greenland extra challenging.

item.title: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative Is Laying Off Workers in a Major Shift Toward AI-Powered Biology
item.description: The cuts come as the organization overhauls teams to support its renewed science-focused mission.

item.title: Another ‘central casting’ central banker: Trump’s pick of Kevin Warsh fits a well-established pattern
item.description: Nearly a decade ago, Trump reportedly doubted Janet Yellen was tall enough to be Fed chair. His choice was Jerome Powell.

item.title: Why is it so cold if there’s global warming? Extreme winter weather can deepen misconceptions about climate
item.description: Record cold temperatures are once again expected to hit a swath of the country this weekend—even plunging Florida into its coldest stretch of the last...

item.title: You might qualify for this Kaiser settlement without ever filing a complaint

item.title: Businesses Can Save Money on Ads by Using AI—as Long as They Follow These 3 Rules
item.description: A Columbia Business School study unpacks the effect of human perception on AI ad performance.

item.title: Capitalizing on Meteoric Growth, Kalshi Sets Up A Lobbying Shop in DC
item.description: Facing new court challenges, the prediction market darling looks to make political allies on regulators’ home turf.
